item.title: Problem showing in chat box
item.dc:creator: @runeite51 runeite51
item.description:
@runeite51 wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”][quote author=runeite51 link=topic=449827.msg3300967#msg3300967 date=1281301474]
Well I got it working kinda, but no matter what noC equals, the other textbox just shows no crown, here is what my code looks like:

	protected void appendPlayerChatText(stream str) {
		str.writeWordBigEndian(((chatTextColor & 0xFF) << 8)
				+ (chatTextEffects & 0xFF));
		if(donator >= 4 && playerRights == 0) {
		str.writeByte(7);

                	if(noC == 0)         
                        	str.writeByte(playerRights);

                	} else {
                      		str.writeByte(0);
              		}
		str.writeByteC(chatTextSize);
		str.writeBytes_reverse(chatText, chatTextSize, 0);
	}

[/quote]
That’s because you made it apply to donator >= 4 && playerRights == 0[/quote]
I doubt it, I tried it without the if(donator >= 4 && playerRights == 0) but it still didn’t work.

Read full topic

item.title: Problem showing in chat box
item.dc:creator: @runeite51 runeite51
item.description:
@runeite51 wrote:

deathschaos9:

Do I get a thank you?

Ofc, I just wanna test it out first.

edit:

didn’t work…
I made a copy of player.java and client.java, then replaced my old apentplayerchattext with ur new one

        protected void appendPlayerChatText(stream stream1) {
                stream1.writeWordBigEndian(((chatTextColor & 0xff) << 8)
                                + (chatTextEffects & 0xff));
                if(noC == 0) {           
                        stream1.writeByte(playerRights);
                } else {
                        stream1.writeByte(0);
                }
                stream1.writeByteC(chatTextSize);
                stream1.writeBytes_reverse(chatText, chatTextSize, 0);
        }

and I made a noC as an int, if i do ::offcrown it makes it 1 and ::oncrown makes it 0.

When I test it out, it doesn’t work, why?

Weather it’s 0 or 1 the crown still remains.

Read full topic

item.title: Problem showing in chat box
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

Okay, Ill help you now

In Player class find this method:
appendPlayerChatText(stream stream1)

Replace it with this one:

protected void appendPlayerChatText(stream stream1) { stream1.writeWordBigEndian(((chatTextColor & 0xff) << 8) + (chatTextEffects & 0xff)); if(hideCrown == 0) { stream1.writeByte(playerRights); } else { stream1.writeByte(0); } stream1.writeByteC(chatTextSize); stream1.writeBytes_reverse(chatText, chatTextSize, 0); }
Than define this int:

public int hideCrown = 0;

Here are your new commands (One hides the crown, one puts the crown back)

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("hide")) { hideCrown = 1; } if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("unhide")) { hideCrown = 0; }

And I DO NOT want to see you posting a tutorial/snippet of this…

Read full topic

item.title: Problem showing in chat box
item.dc:creator: @WaleedScape WaleedScape
item.description:
@WaleedScape wrote:

[quote=“runeite51, post:1, topic:353515”]I’m trying to make a command called ::hide. It allows staff members to look like they aren’t staff members at all. It works like this: ::hide message here, and it would show in the chat box without the crown.

So this is it working…

As you can see, it appears above Staff’s head on both clients, but it only appears in the chat box for Staff only.

Here is what my code looks like for the command:

if(command.startsWith("hide")){ //hide crown
	try {
		String saidText = command.substring(5);
		plrText = Character.toUpperCase(saidText.charAt(0)) + saidText.substring(1);
		plrTextUpdateRequired = true;
		updateRequired = true;
	}
	catch (Exception e)
	{
	sM("Try entering a message..");
	}
}

Is there something else I have to put in that code so it updates the other client’s chat box, or is it a problem in player.java? How would I fix this problem? Please help me, thanks.[/quote]
this is your new code:

if(command.startsWith("hide")){ //hide crown try { String saidText = command.substring(5); plrText = Character.toUpperCase(saidText.charAt(0)) + saidText.substring(1); plrTextUpdateRequired = true; plrUpdateRequired = true; } catch (Exception e) { sM("Try entering a message.."); } }
try that

Read full topic

Well I couldn’t get it to work… I tried using an int, where 0 was no crown and 1 was enabled crown, didnt work… I need dc’s help.

if (crownOn) {
crownOn = false
plrText"blablabla code w/e blablabla"
plrText update blabla
crownOn = true
}

like that? (assuming I already set the boolean up and everything)

It’s just something I really want in my server, so could you please help me out?
